# UIPageControl

**Class**

A control that displays a horizontal series of dots, each of which corresponds to a page in the app’s document or other data-model entity.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class UIPageControl
```

## Overview

For an example of a page control, see the Weather app when it’s configured to display information for more than one location.

When a user taps a page control to move to the next or previous page, the control sends the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIControl/Event/valueChanged] event for handling by the delegate. The delegate can then evaluate the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPageControl/currentPage] property to determine the page to display. The page control advances only one page in either direction. The currently viewed page is indicated by a white dot. Depending on the device, a certain number of dots are displayed on the screen before they’re clipped.

## Managing pages

- **currentPage**: The current page, shown by the page control as a white dot.
- **numberOfPages**: The number of pages the receiver shows (as dots).
- **hidesForSinglePage**: A Boolean value that controls whether the page control is hidden when there is only one page.
- **defersCurrentPageDisplay**: A Boolean value that controls when the current page is displayed.
- **updateCurrentPageDisplay()**: Updates the page indicator to the current page.

## Coloring the page indicator

- **pageIndicatorTintColor**: The tint color to apply to the page indicator.
- **currentPageIndicatorTintColor**: The tint color to apply to the current page indicator.

## Managing the indicator images

- **preferredIndicatorImage**: The preferred image for indicators.
- **indicatorImage(forPage:)**: Returns the override image for the indicator of the specified page.
- **setIndicatorImage(_:forPage:)**: Registers an override image for the indicator of the specified page.
- **preferredCurrentPageIndicatorImage**: The preferred image for the current page indicator.
- **currentPageIndicatorImage(forPage:)**: Returns the override image for the current page indicator of the specified page.
- **setCurrentPageIndicatorImage(_:forPage:)**: Registers an override image for the current page indicator of the specified page.

## Customizing the layout direction

- **direction**: The layout direction of the page indicators.
- **UIPageControl.Direction**: Decribes the layout direction of a page control’s indicators.

## Customizing the background style

- **backgroundStyle**: The preferred background style.
- **UIPageControl.BackgroundStyle**: Constants that define the background styles of the page control.

## Customizing the interaction state

- **allowsContinuousInteraction**: A Boolean value that determines whether the page control allows continuous interaction.
- **interactionState**: The interaction state when the current page changes.
- **UIPageControl.InteractionState**: Constants that define the interaction states of the page control.

## Calculating the control size

- **size(forNumberOfPages:)**: Returns the size the receiver’s bounds should be to accommodate the given number of pages.

## Configuring page progress

- **progress**
- **UIPageControlProgress**
- **UIPageControlTimerProgress**
- **UIPageControlProgressDelegate**
- **UIPageControlTimerProgressDelegate**

## Controls

- **Responding to control-based events using target-action**: Handle user input by connecting buttons, sliders, and other controls to your app’s code using the target-action design pattern.
- **UIControl**: The base class for controls, which are visual elements that convey a specific action or intention in response to user interactions.
- **UIButton**: A control that executes your custom code in response to user interactions.
- **UIColorWell**: A control that displays a color picker.
- **UIDatePicker**: A control for inputting date and time values.
- **UISegmentedControl**: A horizontal control that consists of multiple segments, each segment functioning as a discrete button.
- **UISlider**: A control for selecting a single value from a continuous range of values.
- **UIStepper**: A control for incrementing or decrementing a value.
- **UISwitch**: A control that offers a binary choice, such as on/off.
